title: MCMC Demonstration
text: demonstrate usage package, can simulate genotyping data according model, allowing relatedness within samples population. Now data, let’s go ahead run MCMC. run 20 parallel tempered chains temperature gradient ranging \([.5, 1]\) running MCMC, can access draws posterior distribution analyze.
code: set.seed(17325) mean_moi <- 5 num_biological_samples <- 100 epsilon_pos <- .01 epsilon_neg <- .03 # Generate the number of alleles at each locus allele_counts <- c(rep(5, 15), rep(10, 15), rep(25, 15), rep(50, 15))  # We'll use flat alpha vectors for our draws from the Dirichlet locus_freq_alphas <- lapply(allele_counts, function(allele) rep(1, allele)) simulated_data <- moire::simulate_data(   mean_moi,   num_biological_samples,   epsilon_pos, epsilon_neg,   locus_freq_alphas = locus_freq_alphas,   internal_relatedness_alpha = .1,   internal_relatedness_beta = 1 ) burnin <- 1e4 num_samples <- 1e4 pt_chains <- seq(1, .5, length.out = 20)  mcmc_results <- moire::run_mcmc(   simulated_data,   verbose = T, burnin = burnin, samples_per_chain = num_samples,   pt_chains = pt_chains, pt_num_threads = length(pt_chains), thin = 10 ) # Estimate the COI for each sample coi_summary <- moire::summarize_coi(mcmc_results)  # We can also summarize statistics about the allele frequency distribution he_summary <- moire::summarize_he(mcmc_results) allele_freq_summary <- moire::summarize_allele_freqs(mcmc_results) relatedness_summary <- moire::summarize_relatedness(mcmc_results) effective_coi_summary <- moire::summarize_effective_coi(mcmc_results)  # Let's append the true values for use later sample_data <- data.frame(   coi_summary, effective_coi_summary, relatedness_summary,   true_coi = simulated_data$sample_cois,   true_effective_coi = (simulated_data$sample_cois - 1) * (1 - simulated_data$sample_relatedness) + 1,   true_relatedness = simulated_data$sample_relatedness   )  he_data <- data.frame(   he_summary,   true_he = sapply(     moire::calculate_naive_allele_frequencies(simulated_data$true_genotypes),     function(x) moire::calculate_he(x)   ),   naive_he = sapply(     moire::calculate_naive_allele_frequencies(simulated_data$data),     function(x) moire::calculate_he(x)   ) )  allele_freq_data <- data.frame(   allele_freq_summary,   naive_allele_frequency = unlist(     moire::calculate_naive_allele_frequencies(simulated_data$data)   ),   true_allele_frequency = unlist(     moire::calculate_naive_allele_frequencies(simulated_data$true_genotypes)   ) )

title: MCMC Demonstration
text: demonstrate difference distribution estimate COI using approach vs naive method taking maximum number alleles observed (Naive Estimate), second highest number alleles observed (Offset Naive Estimate). Mean distribution annotated dotted line.  Since simulated data, know true complexity infection can compare estimates. Observations ordered COI dotted lines delimiting total COI.
code: coi_estimates <- sample_data |>   dplyr::select(post_coi_med, naive_coi, offset_naive_coi, true_coi, sample_id) |>   tidyr::pivot_longer(-sample_id,                       names_to = "estimator",                       values_to = "estimate") |>   dplyr::mutate(estimator_pretty = case_when(     estimator == "post_coi_med" ~ "Median Posterior Est.",     estimator == "naive_coi" ~ "Naive Estimate",     estimator == "offset_naive_coi" ~ "Offset Naive Estimate",     estimator == "true_coi" ~ "True COI")) |>   transform(estimator_pretty = factor(estimator_pretty, levels = c(     "True COI",     "Median Posterior Est.",     "Offset Naive Estimate",     "Naive Estimate"   )))  coi_estimate_summaries <- coi_estimates |>    dplyr::group_by(estimator_pretty) |>    dplyr::summarise(mean = mean(estimate))  ggplot() +   geom_bar(data=coi_estimates, aes(x = estimate, group = estimator_pretty, fill = estimator_pretty, stat(count))) +   geom_vline(data=coi_estimate_summaries, aes(xintercept=mean, group = estimator_pretty), linetype="dashed") +   facet_wrap(~estimator_pretty, ncol = 1) +   xlab("Complexity of Infection") +   ylab("Total Count") +   labs(fill="Estimator") +   theme_classic(base_size = 12) +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90),         strip.background = element_blank(),         strip.text = element_blank()) #> Warning: `stat(count)` was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `after_stat(count)` instead. coi_compare_to_truth <- sample_data |>   dplyr::select(post_coi_mean, naive_coi, offset_naive_coi, true_coi, sample_id, post_coi_lower, post_coi_upper) |>   tidyr::pivot_longer(c(-sample_id, -true_coi, -post_coi_lower, -post_coi_upper),                       names_to = "estimator",                       values_to = "estimate") |>   dplyr::mutate(     estimator_pretty = case_when(       estimator == "post_coi_mean" ~ "Posterior Est.",       estimator == "naive_coi" ~ "Naive Estimate",       estimator == "offset_naive_coi" ~ "Offset Naive Estimate"       ),     sample_id = forcats::fct_reorder(sample_id, true_coi, min),     ymin = case_when(       estimator == "post_coi_mean" ~ post_coi_lower - true_coi,       estimator == "naive_coi" ~ estimate - true_coi,       estimator == "offset_naive_coi" ~ estimate - true_coi     ),     ymax = case_when(       estimator == "post_coi_mean" ~ post_coi_upper - true_coi,       estimator == "naive_coi" ~ estimate - true_coi,       estimator == "offset_naive_coi" ~ estimate - true_coi     )     ) |>   transform(estimator_pretty = factor(estimator_pretty, levels = c(     "Posterior Est.",     "Offset Naive Estimate",     "Naive Estimate"   ))) |>    dplyr::arrange(true_coi)  coi_bins <- sample_data |>    dplyr::group_by(true_coi) |>    dplyr::summarize(n = n()) |>    dplyr::mutate(pos = cumsum(n))   ggplot(data=coi_compare_to_truth, aes(x = sample_id, y = estimate - true_coi, ymin = ymin, ymax = ymax, group = estimator_pretty, color = estimator_pretty)) +   geom_errorbar() +   geom_point(alpha = 1) +   facet_wrap(~estimator_pretty, ncol = 1) +   geom_hline(yintercept=0, linetype="dashed", alpha=.5) +   geom_vline(data=coi_bins, aes(xintercept = pos), linetype = "dotted", alpha = .5) +   xlab("Sample") +   ylab("Estimate - True COI") +   labs(color="Estimator") +   theme_classic(base_size = 12) +   theme(axis.text.x = element_blank(),         axis.ticks.x = element_blank(),         strip.background = element_blank(),         strip.text = element_blank())

text: metric can interpreted expected number alleles observed within sample locus infinite diversity (.e. \(H_e = 1\)). case zero within-host relatedness, every allele observed unique thus effective COi equal actual complexity infection. relatedness approaches 1, expected number alleles converges 1 matter underlying true COI. turns relationship linear, can expressed \(COI_{eff} = (COI - 1) * (1 - r) + 1\) r probability strains related (thus identical genetics) across genome. results continuous metric shrinks COI towards 1 relatedness increases, thus differences mean COI mean effective COI may signal reduced diversity increased -breeding. can see moire able accurately recover true underlying effective COI despite potential identifiability issues relatedness COI independently. title: Sample from the target distribution using MCMC — run_mcmc
text: data Data used MCMC, generated load_*_data functions is_missing Boolean matrix indicating whether observation treated missing data ignored. Number rows equals number loci, number columns equals number samples. Alternatively, user may pass FALSE data considered missing. allow_relatedness Bool indicating whether allow relatedness within host thin Positive Integer. often sample mcmc, 1 means thin burnin Positive Integer. Number MCMC samples discard burnin samples_per_chain Positive Integer. Number samples take burnin verbose Logical indicating progress printed eps_pos_alpha Positive Numeric. Alpha parameter Beta distribution eps_pos prior eps_pos_beta Positive Numeric. Beta parameter Beta distribution eps_pos prior eps_neg_alpha Positive Numeric. Alpha parameter Beta distribution eps_neg prior eps_neg_beta Positive Numeric. Beta parameter Beta distribution eps_neg prior mean_coi_shape shape parameter gamma hyperprior mean COI mean_coi_scale scale parameter gamma hyperprior mean COI max_eps_pos Numeric. Maximum allowed value eps_pos max_eps_neg Numeric. Maximum allowed value eps_neg max_coi Positive Numeric. Maximum allowed complexity infection num_chains Total number chains run, possibly simultaneously num_cores Total OMP parallel threads use run chains. num_cores * pt_num_threads exceed number cores available system. pt_chains Total number chains run parallel tempering vector containing temperatures used parallel tempering. pt_grad Power raise parallel tempering chains . value 1 results evenly distributed temperatures [0,1], 1 bias towards 1 1 bias towards 0. pt_num_threads Total number OMP parallel threads used process parallel tempered chains num_cores * pt_num_threads exceed number cores available system.

title: moire 3.0.0
text: major revision moire, introducing simplified API functionality infer within host relatedness effective MOI. release also introduces parallel tempering based approach leverages OpenMP, greatly improving mixing MCMC.

title: moire 2.2.0
text: Added support running multiple chains simultaneously, pooling output fix bug missing data various bugfixes improvements

title: moire 2.1.0
text: Implemented new error model removes sensitivity total number alleles locus Removed option marginalize latent genotypes complexity threshold bug fixes, documentation improvements

title: moire 2.0.1
text: Minor bugfix sampling caused computational slow

title: moire 2.0.0
text: Underlying model longer uses pseudo marginal MH algorithm. Instead, model augmented latent genotypes user defined complexity level sampled. Loci user defined complexity level latent state fully marginalized . Removed dependency GSL various bugfixes speedups

title: moire 1.1.1
text: fixed overflow bug dramatically increase computational costs fixed bug sampling complexity infection accepted updates weren’t recorded cases

title: moire 1.1.0
text: Added several new common functions analyzing data Added functions import data common formats format required Made errors independent parameter across samples Changed error model longer depend underlying number strains contributing alleles Removed multiple chain implementations. multiple chains desired, use multiprocessing Added progress bar duration MCMC
